TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CodeGeneratorOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a set of options used by a code generator.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions> is passed to the code generation methods of an <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator> implementation to specify options used during code generation.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.IndentString%2A> property specifies the string to use for each spacing indentation. The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.BracingStyle%2A> property specifies the placement style for braces indicating the boundaries of code blocks. The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.ElseOnClosing%2A> property specifies whether to append an `else`, `catch`, or `finally` block, including brackets, at the closing line of each `if` or `try` block. The <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.BlankLinesBetweenMembers%2A> property specifies whether to insert blank lines between members.
An <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator> implementation can provide custom code generation options which you can set or pass data to using the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.Item%2A> dictionary indexer, which a code generator can search through to locate additional code generation options.
> [!NOTE] > This class contains a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members. A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have full-trust permission. For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) and [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).
## Examples [!code-cpp[CodeGeneratorOptionsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeGeneratorOptionsExample/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[CodeGeneratorOptionsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeGeneratorOptionsExample/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CodeGeneratorOptionsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeGeneratorOptionsExample/VB/class1.vb#1)]

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This class cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This class cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This class cannot be used by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BlankLinesBetweenMembers { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BlankLinesBetweenMembers : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to insert blank lines between members.
Docs.value: true if blank lines should be inserted; otherwise, false. By default, the value of this property is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BracingStyle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.BracingStyle : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style to use for bracing.
Docs.value: A string containing the bracing style to use.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is `Block`, which indicates that code should be generated so that braces start on the same line as the statement or declaration that they are associated with. A property value of `C` indicates that braces start on the line following the statement or declaration that they are associated with.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ElseOnClosing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ElseOnClosing : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to append an else, catch, or finally block, including brackets, at the closing line of each previous if or try block.
Docs.value: true if an else should be appended; otherwise, false. The default value of this property is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ IndentString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.IndentString : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the string to use for indentations.
Docs.value: A string containing the characters to use for indentations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is "/----/" (four spaces).

MemberSignature.Value: public object this[string index] { get; set; }
Default Public Property Item(index As String) As Object
public: property System::Object ^ default[System::String ^] { System::Object ^ get(System::String ^ index); void set(System::String ^ index, System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Item(string) : obj with get, set

Docs.param: The name associated with the object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object at the specified index.
Docs.value: The object associated with the specified name. If no object associated with the specified name exists in the collection, null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This dictionary provides an extensibility mechanism for developers to provide data for custom features of a code generator. A code generator must implement such features and support checking the dictionary for this to be useful.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool VerbatimOrder { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.VerbatimOrder : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to generate members in the order in which they occur in member collections.
Docs.value: true to generate the members in the order in which they occur in the member collection; otherwise, false. The default value of this property is false.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default generates members by their type, for example; field, member, constructor, or property. A code generator can use the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions.VerbatimOrder%2A> property to inject #region blocks into code, thus changing the order.
